html: 1.22.17  11:22 pm   Hello, I now got that you wanted to forward the blame of mispronunciation from yourself to the source video maker. html: 1.22.17  8:04 pm   Aince reading this questions page, i have incorporated "oh hell yeah" into my everyday speech. (it is a wonderful phrase and i thank you for bringing it into my life) But what do I do when the people around me get upset from the usage of the word "hell"? It is especially frustrating that a phrase with such a positive meaning gets turned around and misunderstood to be a very negative meaning. I am not religious, so I don't even think about it being offensive, but how am I supposed to bridge the gap to their side?
